memberdef.name: UTEST_INITIALIZER
memberdef.initializer: static void f(void) UTEST_ATTRIBUTE(constructor); \ static void f(void)

memberdef.name: UTEST_SKIP
memberdef.initializer: do { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Skipped : '%s'\n", (msg)); \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_SKIPPED; \ return; \ } while (0)

memberdef.name: UTEST_COND
memberdef.initializer: UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ if (!((x)cond(y))) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure (Expected " #cond " Actual)", __FILE__, \ __LINE__); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s", msg); \ } \ UTEST_PRINTF("\n"); \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_TRUE
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const int xEval = !!(x); \ if (!(xEval)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : true
"); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : %s
", (xEval) ? "true" : "false"); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_FALSE
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const int xEval = !!(x); \ if (xEval) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : false
"); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : %s
", (xEval) ? "true" : "false"); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_STREQ
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const char *xEval = (x); \ const char *yEval = (y); \ if (UTEST_NULL == xEval || UTEST_NULL == yEval || \ 0 != strcmp(xEval, yEval)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : "%s"
", xEval); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : "%s"
", yEval); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_STRNE
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const char *xEval = (x); \ const char *yEval = (y); \ if (UTEST_NULL == xEval || UTEST_NULL == yEval || \ 0 == strcmp(xEval, yEval)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : "%s"
", xEval); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : "%s"
", yEval); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_STRNEQ
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const char *xEval = (x); \ const char *yEval = (y); \ const size_t nEval = UTEST_CAST(size_t, n); \ if (UTEST_NULL == xEval || UTEST_NULL == yEval || \ 0 != UTEST_STRNCMP(xEval, yEval, nEval)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : "%.*s"
", UTEST_CAST(int, nEval), xEval); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : "%.*s"
", UTEST_CAST(int, nEval), yEval); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_STRNNE
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const char *xEval = (x); \ const char *yEval = (y); \ const size_t nEval = UTEST_CAST(size_t, n); \ if (UTEST_NULL == xEval || UTEST_NULL == yEval || \ 0 == UTEST_STRNCMP(xEval, yEval, nEval)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : "%.*s"
", UTEST_CAST(int, nEval), xEval); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : "%.*s"
", UTEST_CAST(int, nEval), yEval); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_NEAR
memberdef.initializer:
UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_BEGIN do { \ const double diff = \ utest_fabs(UTEST_CAST(double, x) - UTEST_CAST(double, y)); \ if (diff > UTEST_CAST(double, epsilon) || utest_isnan(diff)) { \ UTEST_PRINTF("%s:%i: Failure
", __FILE__, __LINE__); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Expected : %f
", UTEST_CAST(double, x)); \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Actual : %f
", UTEST_CAST(double, y)); \ if (strlen(msg) > 0) { \ UTEST_PRINTF(" Message : %s
", msg); \ } \ *utest_result = UTEST_TEST_FAILURE; \ if (is_assert) { \ return; \ } \ } \ } \ while (0) \ UTEST_SURPRESS_WARNING_END

memberdef.name: UTEST_I_SETUP
memberdef.initializer: static void utest_i_setup_##FIXTURE( \ int *utest_result, struct FIXTURE *utest_fixture, size_t utest_index)

memberdef.name: UTEST_I_TEARDOWN
memberdef.initializer: static void utest_i_teardown_##FIXTURE( \ int *utest_result, struct FIXTURE *utest_fixture, size_t utest_index)

memberdef.name: UTEST_MAIN
memberdef.initializer: UTEST_STATE(); \ int main(int argc, const char *const argv[]) { \ return utest_main(argc, argv); \ }

memberdef.argsstring: (const utest_int64_t value, const utest_int64_t numer, const utest_int64_t denom)
memberdef.name: utest_mul_div
